result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Rebecca A VanZile was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant must have IID installed in any operation of a vehicle and in any vehicle licensed or titled in her name, upon the issuance of a valid driver's license.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
The defendant must undergo a psychological assessment and follow through with any recommendations.
No consumption or possession of alcohol. No entry into any bars or taverns, except for work purposes only.

The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

The defendant must attend at least one AA/NA or similar type community meeting per week.

timeConds.notes: Huber, good time allowed and eligible for community service.
To be completed within the first two yearst of probation.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Rebecca A VanZile in court with attorney Chad Lynch.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 9:29 AM. State - there is a resolution and DE would be entering G plea to CT 1 as alleged, CT 2 - dismissed, CT 3 - DRI. 3 year probation with 365 days in FC jail, $3214 fine, reimburse $35 blood draw, 36 revoke DL and IID, AODA and follow through, no consumption or possession of alcohol, no entry into any bars or taverns, FT emp/schooling, 200 hours community service, attend one AA/NA or similar meeting per week. Lynch states she has one day credit and asks for work to be allowed at casino. VanZile understands and agrees. Court dismisses CT 2 and DRI in CT 3. VanZile pleads guilty to CT 1. Court goes over PLQ with VanZile and finds that she is freely, voluntairly and intelligently entering her plea, court finds factual basis, adjudges guilty and finds defendant waives her constiutional rights and rights to trial. Admits to three prior convictions. State makes final statement and aks court to follow joint recommendation. Lynch makes final statement and asks court to follow joint recommendation. VanZile makes statement, remorseful. Court will accept joint recommendation and sentences: CT 3 - With hold sentence and place on probation for 3 years with conditions: serve 365 days in FC jail, huber and good time allowed, as well as community service - report today, fine of $3,214 (plus DNA costs), reimburse FC sheriff $35 for blood draw, revoke DL for 36 months, subjected to IID for 36 months - operation of any vehicle and must be installed in any vehicle titled/registered in her name and upon issuance of a valid driver's license, AODA and follow through, no consumption or possession of alcohol, no entry into any bars or taverns except for employment purposes, FT emp/schooling, 200 hours community service - to be completed within the first 2 years of probation, attend one AA/NA or similar type community meeting per week, pchycological assessment and follow through with recommendations, 1 day credit. Appeal, voting and firearm rights given, DNA sample required - expunction rights given for DNA.
Final pre-trial on June 17, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Rebecca A VanZile in court with attorney Chad Lynch.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 3:49 PM. State calls Deputy William Voss. Voss sworn in at 3:40 PM. Direct exam by State. Record reflectsproper identification of the defendant. State offers exhibit #1, certified driving record of the defendant. Court receives after no objections (4:00 PM). Lynch stipulates to three prior convictions. Cross exam by Lynch at 4:02 PM. Voss excused. Court finds probable cause that a felony was commited, binds over for trial. State files Information that mirrors the complaint. Lynch has Information, waives reading of it, will proceed to ARGN and enters NG pleas to all charges. Court accepts pleas, continues bond, sets for FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 17, 2016 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on April 25, 2016 at 04:00 pm.

Defendant Rebecca A VanZile in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:22 AM. Vanzile handed complaint in Court. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Vanzile understands charges and penalties, wants an attorney, cannot afford to hire her own, recess to talk to SPD. Recalled at 9:53 AM, now appears with Attorney Lynch. Lynch has complaint, waives reading, will request PH but waives time limits. Court considers time limits waived, continues bond, set for PH on 4/25/16 at 4:00 PM.
